result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

SIGNATURE BOND SET - $500 PER CASE - REFERRAL TO DCPS
-You may be responsible for paying the amount of your signature bond if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
-The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report by 4/7/22 AT 1:00 PM. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: x GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
